# Public Health Environmental Surveillance Evaluation Framework (PHES-EF)
:::

------------------------------------------------------------------------

<!-- HOME PAGE TEXT -->

:::: intro-container
::: justify-text
The <i>Public Health Environmental Surveillance Evaluation Framework (PHES-EF)</i> is an international consensus study developing a comprehensive framework to evaluate public health environmental surveillance systems. We use wastewater-based surveillance as our primary example.<br>

<b>Our approach:</b> We employ the Delphi methodâ€”an iterative survey process using structured feedback and expert anonymity to build consensus. A diverse panel of global experts will help us create an evidence-informed framework for assessing surveillance system performance. [Learn more about the Delphi study.](https://phes-ef.org/delphi.html)

<b>Next steps:</b> Active recruitment (fall) 2025) and launch of the Delphi consensus process (winter 2025).

<div style="margin-top: 1.5rem; padding: 1rem; background-color: #f8f9fa; border-left: 4px solid #8c4d33; border-radius: 4px;">
